title: Effects of Dust Coagulation on Streaming Instability
authors: Ka Wai Ho, Hui Li, Shengtai Li
abstract:
Streaming Instability (SI) in dust has long been thought to be a promising
process in triggering planetesimal formation in the protoplanetary disks
(PPDs). In this study, we present the first numerical investigation that models
the SI in the vertically stratified disk together with the dust coagulation
process. Our simulations reveal that, even with the initial small dust sizes,
because dust coagulation promotes dust size growth, SI can eventually still be
triggered. As such, the dust coagulation process broadens the parameter
boundaries obtained from the previous SI studies using single dust species. We
describe the various stages of dust dynamics along with their size evolution,
and explore the impact of different dust fragmentation velocities. Implications
of these results for realistic PPDs are also discussed.
